 In addition, an old English preacher by the name of Smith Wigglesworth once said, "If you leave people as you found them, God is not speaking through you. If you are not making people either mad or glad, there is something wrong with your ministry. If there's not a war going on, you're not doing your job."
 
 Another commentator, a guy by the name of Arthur Wallis, speaking on the Apostolic style of preaching that we see in the Book of Acts, said, "Such preaching makes indifference to the word of God impossible - it sets the hearers into one of two camps. It's calculated to either produce a revival or a riot."

 And maybe you shouldn't make assumptions about my safety level. A conservative Republican government promised no new taxes and a balanced the budget with cuts everywhere. This led to hundreds of police being let go. Crime has skyrocketed in my neighborhood. This summer there has been half a dozen gang related murders within a block of me. One day when my son was playing basketball with friends (chaperoned) at a local park and had to hit the pavement to dodge bullets from a drive-by shooting. My sister lives eight blocks from me - had a drunk car theif drive through her fence and into her back yard narrowly missing the house right where my son was sleeping. The perp left his jacket and wallet in the car. The police did nothing as they no longer have the resources to investigate a crime where nobody was hurt and the property (car) was returned. The property damage to my sister was around $5k, the car owner even more so.

 The problem being that virtually every US police force from state down to podunk crossroad towns receive significant portions of their operating budgets from the federal government's war on drugs program. As, to a much lesser extent, do the US military, the CIA and the FBI. In the world of bureaucracy under current administration drug enforcement carries great political and financial benefits for politicians, never known for their logic or reasoning when it comes to expanding or financing their power bases. Our system of government has obviously become morally corrupt. 
 
 How many politicians do you see on the street where drugs are openly sold? You can't even protest that without a permit and confinement in a police guarded area removed from the presence of public officials. The current US definition of what seems to be Christian morality without alternatives is an extremely effective means of control when public funds are readily available for enforcement.
